IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our equipment in your area. This has identified cables and 6 poles that need replacing and upgrading. We will also be replacing stay wires and transferring service cables to the new poles. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate your area has been impacted with unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. To complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off to upgrade the equipment. To ensure the power is off for the shortest possible time, our contractors may carry out preparation works prior to the power cut. This work is taking place in Cooks Drove. A road closure will be in place to allow the work to be carried out safely. Access to your property will always be provided.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine a transformer on our electricity poles to check it is functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place near Airfield Industrial Estate.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 15:52 - We can now confirm that all power in the TN5 7 area should be back on. Our engineers have diverted power around an overhead cable that has been damaged by a fallen tree to get the majority of customers back on. However, due to the location and complexity of the issue, we have also used a temporary generators to restore power to the last of the affected properties. This will provide power until our engineers plan in and safely complete the full repair, which may take a few days.

We're really sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused. If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 14:47 - Hello again. Thanks for bearing with us during the power cut, I know the lights being off is a worry.

Our staff have advised that further work is required on site to allow them to safely connect the generators. Due to the delay this has caused, they've advised a new time of 16:30-17:30 to have your power back on.

I know another delay is frustrating; our engineers always try to give us the best estimate that they can but due to the safety elements of working with live electricity, sometimes they have to adjust their repairs at short notice.

I'm sorry if this has caused you to change any plans you've made, but we'll be here to update you until the lights are safely back on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Hi, Simon from the messaging team here; just a quick recap on what's happened during the power cut so far. Our engineers are still on site working to repair the overhead cables and connect a temporary generator in the TN5 7 area. We have managed to get power restored to 38 properties, so currently 8 properties are still affected by the overhead network fault. We are still trying to gain an updated restoration time from the teams on site. If your power is back on now, please follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to stop SMS updates. I'm sorry for the continued disruption, but I'll keep you informed with news from site. If you have any concerns, please call us on 08003163105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Roland at 14:34 - Thanks for your patience today. Our engineers have now repaired the grounded overhead cables, and have deemed it safe to restore power back to all 927 properties in the King's Lynn PE34 4 area.

We're very sorry we had to turn your power off unexpectedly, and with so little warning. We usually provide much more notice if we can, but in a situation like this our first priority is the safety of the public and our staff.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. If your power is still off or if you have any questions, call our team on 08003163105.w
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi there. We've just had a shift change, so Bev, Aaron, Roland and Simon are now here to keep you updated with progress from our field teams.

We know it's frustrating being without power, but we wanted to assure you we're still here and as soon as we have some more information we'll update you again.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Is your power back on? We keep texting those signed up, and will continue to until the final 21 customers are restored. Want to stop receiving text updates? You will need to visit our website here - https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Thank you.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.

Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Name: Power back on

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 12:15 - We can now confirm that all power in the Westbrook Crescent area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault with some of our network equipment, which our engineers have now replaced.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 12:03 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Our engineers have arrived on site in the Westbrook Crescent area, the estimated time of 14:30-15:30 hasn't changed. We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress, but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. If you would like more information about what we think the fault is; here's a short YouTube video https://bit.ly/2y8Dtfz. Sent by Theo at 11:53.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 14:10 - We can now confirm that all power in the Chesham Drive area should be back on.

Our staff are trying to find the root cause and fix it permanently, however with this kind of issue it's likely that power will go off multiple times before we're able to find and fix it. For now we have restored your power as quickly as we can.

If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi there. We've just had a shift change, so Simon, Roland and Aaron are now here to keep you updated with progress from our field teams.

We know it's frustrating being without power, but we wanted to assure you we're still here and as soon as we have some more information we'll update you again.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry your power has gone off again.

We believe there may be an underlying issue causing the recent power cuts, but due to the nature of the electricity network, the heat created by a developing fault can cause a break in a cable to reseal itself. This can make it difficult to locate, so while our engineers are testing our equipment thoroughly to pinpoint the issue, this kind of problem may interrupt power multiple times before it's possible for us to fix.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

I'll keep you updated. Sent by Adam at 13:13

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 20:14 - I'm texting to say I am glad to report that power to the London Road area should now be back on.

I'm sorry for the continued disruption recently. We believe there may be a fault on our underground electricity cabling in the area, but currently it has not developed to a stage that our staff can pinpoint it. Their tests have proven inconclusive, so for now they have replaced our safety equipment at the substation to get your power back on as quickly as possible.

This may happen again before we're able to fix it, but if you'd like to talk to us about this, or if your power isn't on call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
I appreciate your continued patience this evening. We want to be as transparent as possible as we know having multiple power cuts is disruptive and worrying, so I would like to help explain why we can't always fix a problem like this right away.

Underground electricity cabling is insulated for safety and if a fault develops, these materials can re-seal due to heat passing through them when our safety equipment operates and your power is lost. This covers any potential fault again, meaning our staff cannot locate it using their tests or specialist equipment.

We'll know more once our staff contact us again, so I'll be in touch again shortly.

Sent by Simon at 19:41.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the London Road area. Due to there being multiple power cuts over a short space of time, our engineers are going to be testing if the network is still healthy.

They will start at the substation, and often apply specialist equipment that may turn your power back on for a brief period, so don't worry if your power comes on and goes off again. They will also check smaller sites which run along our cabling route, these break our network down into smaller sections and can help pinpoint any possible problems.

Our estimated time frame of 23:00-00:00 hasn't changed, so I'll let you know more once our staff update us. Sent by Simon at 19:15.

Sent by Aaron at 21:14 - Thanks for bearing with us tonight.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

We'll update you with all of our progress, but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Roland at 21:32 - Engineers are on their way. At this point we think the issue is a fault with equipment in your local substation in the Juniper Close area. We didn't know this was going to happen, so time frames we provide throughout are estimated and are subject to change.

Our estimated time to have power back on is currently between 00:30 and 01:30, but after we arrive and assess the situation this may change. The reason for this is there can sometimes be a more complex underlying issue found by our engineer's tests which may take longer, and if not we may get power back on sooner.

All of our texts are written and sent personally by our team, and we'll let you know once our staff arrive.

Hi, this is Talie - I wanted to let you know I have just taken over for the night shift, so I'll be here until tomorrow morning making sure you have the latest news from our staff.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have arrived on site in the Maidstone ME14 area to investigate the power cut affecting 40 properties.

Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Sent by Simon at 21:49.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Simon at 21:43 - Hi - thanks for bearing with us, I know a power cut can be very disruptive. We've had an update from our staff that there are now 40 properties still affected by the underground cable fault, as they have managed to safely divert some power, getting the lights back on for 16 of our customers. We'll keep sending text updates to everyone until all the power to your area is on. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Simon at 20:36 - Our engineers are on their way. We believe the issue is an underground network fault that initially interrupted power to 291 properties. However, we have managed to divert power back to some properties, so 56 properties are still affected. Specialist engineers from our control room will continue to divert power remotely, so your power may come back on at any point. Sometimes we can't restore everyone this way, so we're also sending staff to check our equipment. We're currently estimating power will be on between 23:30-00:30, but this may change depending on what our staff find. Power back on? To stop receiving texts, follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Otherwise, we'll keep you updated.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 20:25. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically
